conclusion: Analyze the projectile motion of the slider from point B to point C to find the angle between the velocity and the horizontal direction when it lands at point C.
Given height of the experimental platform above the ground h = 0.53 m, radius of the arc R = 0.4 m, angle θ = 37°.
Calculate the height of point C relative to the ground using the geometry of the arc: h_C = R (1 - cos θ) = 0.08 m.
Determine the height difference between B and C: h_B - h_C = h - h_C = 0.45 m.
The slider is launched from point B with an initial horizontal velocity v_B.
Find the time t it takes to fall from B to C using the vertical motion equation: t = √(0.45/4.9) ≈ 0.3 s.
Calculate the horizontal velocity v_x at point C: v_x = v_B.
Calculate the vertical velocity v_y at point C: v_y = g t = 2.94 m/s.
Determine the angle φ between the velocity vector and the horizontal direction: tan φ = v_y/v_x = 2.94/v_B.
Calculate v_B using x_{BC} = v_B × t: v_B = 3 m/s.
The angle between the velocity and the horizontal direction when it lands at point C is 44.4°.
